member.summary: Finds the next row in a DataWindow or DataStore in which data meets a specified condition.
member.param: A string whose value is a boolean expression that you want to use as the search criterion. The expression includes column names.
A value identifying the row location at which to begin the search.
A value identifying the row location at which to end the search.
member.returns: Returns the number of the first row that meets the search criteria within the search range. Returns 0 if no rows are found. -1 General error -5 Bad argument If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.summary: Finds the next row in a DataWindow or DataStore in which data meets a specified condition.

A value identifying the row location at which to begin the search.
A value identifying the row location at which to end the search.
A value indicating the DataWindow buffer you want to search for required row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the first row that meets the search criteria within the search range. Returns 0 if no rows are found. -1 General error -5 Bad argument If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.FindGroupChange(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Searches for the next break for the specified group. A group break occurs when the value in the column for the group changes.
member.param: A value identifying the row at which you want to begin searching for the group break.
The number of the group for which you are searching.
member.returns: Returns 0 if the value in the group column did not change and a negative number if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If the starting row is: (1) The first row in a group, then FindGroupChange returns the starting row number (2) A row within a group, other than the last group, then FindGroupChange returns the row number of the first row of the next group (3) A row in the last group, other than the first row of the last group, then FindGroupChange returns 0

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.FindRequired(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDWBufferValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean)
member.summary: Reports the next row and column that is required and contains a null value.
member.param: A value indicating the DataWindow buffer you want to search for required columns.
A value identifying the first row to be searched. r also stores the number of the found row.
A value identifying the first column to be searched. c also stores the number of the found column.
A string in which you want to store the name of the required column that contains a null value
A value indicating whether you want to validate all rows and columns
member.returns: Returns 1 if FindRequired successfully checked the rows and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob@)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

A read-only blob created by GetStateStatus that is compared with the changeblob to determine the likely success of a subsequent call to SetChanges.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.InsertRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Inserts a row in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row before which you want to insert a row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row that was added if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.IsSelected(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Determines whether a row is selected in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row you want to test to see if it is selected
member.returns: Returns true if row in dwcontrol is selected and false if it is not selected. If row is greater than the number of rows in dwcontrol or is 0 or negative, IsSelected also returns false. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.ModifiedCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that have been modified but not updated in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows that have been modified in the primary buffer. Returns 0 if no rows have been modified or if all modified rows have been updated in the database table. Returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.Modify(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)

member.param: A string whose value is the specifications for the modification.
member.returns: Returns empty string if it succeeds and an error message if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.summary: Applies the contents of a DataWindow blob retrieved by GetFullState to a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A blob that contains the state information you want to apply to the DataWindow control or DataStore
member.returns: Returns -1 if an error occurs 1 DataWindow objects match; old data and state overwritten. 2 DataWindow objects do not match; old object, data, and state replaced. 3 No DataWindow object associated with DataWindow control or DataStore; the DataWindow object associated with the blob is used. The value of the DataObject property remains an empty string. Null If any argument's value is null in PowerBuilder or JavaScript, the method returns null.

The value of the DataObject property remains an empty string. Null If any argument's value is null in PowerBuilder or JavaScript, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.SetHTMLAction(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Accepts action and context information about user interaction with the Web DataWindow client control in a Web browser so that newly generated HTML can reflect any requested changes.
member.param: A string describing an action associated with a button click or method call in a Web DataWindow client control on a Web page.
A string describing the context of action in the Web DataWindow client control.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and one of these negative values if an error occurs: -1 Reloading the current context failed. -2 The action was attempted but it failed. -3 The action could not be performed (for example, the action was InsertRow but the DataWindow has no editable fields for entering new data). -4 The action was aborted by the HTMLContextApplied event. -5 The action is invalid.

The number of the data point for which you want the fill pattern.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type FillPattern in which you want to store the fill pattern value.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, GetDataStyle stores a value of the FillPattern enumerated datatype representing the fill pattern used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRSymbolTypeValue@)

The number of the series in which you want the symbol type of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the symbol type.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type grSymbolType in which you want to store the symbol type.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. Stores, according to the type of symbolvariable, a value of that enumerated datatype representing the symbol used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLineStyleValue@)

member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the line style and width of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the line style and width.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type LineStyle in which you want to store the line style.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, for the specified series and data point, GetDataStyle stores its line style in linestyle and the line's width in linewidth. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLineStyleValue@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt@)
member.summary: Obtains the line style and width for a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the line style and width of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the line style and width.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type LineStyle in which you want to store the line style.
In PowerBuilder, an integer variable in which you want to store the width of the line. The width is measured in pixels.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, for the specified series and data point, GetDataStyle stores its line style in linestyle and the line's width in linewidth. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRColorTypeValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong@)

member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the color of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the color.
A value of the grColorType enumerated datatype (in PowerBuilder) or an integer (in JavaScript) specifying the aspect of the data point for which you want the color.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.Object
member.summary:
Gets the object
The Object property of the DataWindow control lets you specify expressions that refer directly to the data of the DataWindow object in the control. This direct data manipulation allows you to access small and large amounts of data in a single statement, without calling methods.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.DataObject

The name of the DataWindow object

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataStore.FlowDirection
member.summary:
Gets or sets the righttoleft
The RightToLeft property specifies that characters should be displayed in right-to-left order. The application must be running on an operating system that supports right-to-left display.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.CanUndo
member.summary: Tests whether Undo can reverse the most recent edit for an editable control.
member.returns: Returns true if the last edit can be reversed (undone) using the Undo function and false if the last edit cannot be reversed.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Clear
member.summary: Deletes selected text or an OLE object from the specified control, but does not store it in the clipboard.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that Clear removed from objectname. If no text is selected, no characters are removed and Clear returns 0. If an error occurs, Clear returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Copy
member.summary: Puts selected text or an OLE object on the clipboard. Copy does not change the source text or object.
member.returns: Copy returns the number of characters that were copied to the clipboard. If no text is selected in objectref, no characters are copied and Copy returns 0. If an error occurs, Copy returns -1

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Cut
member.summary: Deletes selected text or an OLE object from the specified control and stores it on the clipboard, replacing the clipboard contents with the deleted text or object.
member.returns: Cut returns the number of characters that were cut from controlname and stored in the clipboard. If no text is selected, no characters are cut and Cut returns 0. If an error occurs, Cut returns -1

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Paste
member.summary: Inserts (pastes) the contents of the clipboard into the specified control. For editable controls, text on the clipboard is pasted at the insertion point.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that were pasted into control. If nothing has been cut or copied (the clipboard is empty), the Paste function does not change the contents of the edit control and returns 0. If the clipboard contains nontext data (for example, a bitmap or OLE object) and the control cannot accept that data, Paste does not change the contents and returns 0.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Position
member.summary: Determines the position of the insertion point in an edit control.
member.returns: Returns the location of the insertion point in control if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.ReplaceText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Replaces selected text in an edit control with a specified string.
member.param: The string that replaces the selected text.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters in string and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, ReplaceText returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.SelectedLength
member.summary: Determines the total number of characters in the selected text in an editable control, including spaces and line endings.
member.returns: Returns the length of the selected text in control. If no text is selected, SelectedLength returns 0. If an error occurs, it returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.SelectedStart
member.summary: Reports the position of the first selected character in an editable control.
member.returns: Long. Returns the starting position of the selected text in control. If no text is selected, SelectedStart returns the position of the character immediately following the insertion point. If an error occurs, SelectedStart returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.SelectedText
member.summary: Obtains the selected text in an editable control.
member.returns: Returns the selected text in control. If there is no selected text or if an error occurs, SelectedText returns the empty string ("").

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.SelectText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBULong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBULong)
member.summary: Selects text in an editable control. You specify where the selection begins and how many characters to select.
member.param: A long specifying the position at which you want to start the selection.
A long specifying the number of characters you want to select. If length is 0, no text is selected but PowerBuilder moves the insertion point to the location specified in start.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters selected. If an error occurs, SelectText returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBSingleLineEdit.Undo
member.summary: Cancels the last edit in an edit control, restoring the text to the content before the last change.
member.returns: Returns 1 when it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.AcceptText
member.summary: Applies the contents of the DataWindow's edit control to the current item in the buffer of a DataWindow control or DataStore. The data in the edit control must pass the validation rule for the column before it can be stored in the item.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if it fails If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns 1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ClearValues(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Deletes all the items from a value list or code table associated with a DataWindow column. ClearValues does not affect the data stored in the column.
member.param: column number
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ClearValues(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Deletes all the items from a value list or code table associated with a DataWindow column. ClearValues does not affect the data stored in the column.
member.param: column name
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.DBCancel
member.summary: Cancels the retrieval in process in a DataWindow.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.DBErrorCode
member.summary: Reports the database-specific error code that triggered the DBError event.
member.returns: Returns an error code when a database error occurs -1 Can't connect to the database because of missing values in the transaction object. -2 Can't connect to the database. -3 The key specified in an Update or Retrieve no longer matches an existing row. -4 Writing a blob to the database failed.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.DBErrorMessage
member.summary: Reports the database-specific error message that triggered the DBError event.
member.returns: Returns a string whose value is a database-specific error message generated by a database error.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.DeletedCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that have been marked for deletion in the database.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows that have been deleted from dwcontrol but not updated in the associated database table. Returns 0 if no rows have been deleted or if all the deleted rows have been updated in the database table. DeletedCount returns -1 if it fails. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.DeleteRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Deletes a row from a DataWindow control, DataStore object, or child DataWindow.
member.param: A value identifying the row you want to delete. To delete the current row, specify 0 for row.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the row is successfully deleted and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.Filter
member.summary: Displays rows in a DataWindow that pass the current filter criteria. Rows that do not meet the filter criteria are moved to the filter buffer.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.FilteredCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that are not displayed in the DataWindow because of the current filter criteria.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in dwcontrol that are not displayed because they do not meet the current filter criteria. Returns 0 if all rows are displayed and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetBorderStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Reports the border style of a column in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: The column number for which you want to obtain the border style.
member.returns: Returns the border style of column. Returns null if it fails. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetBorderStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Reports the border style of a column in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: The column number for which you want to obtain the border style.
member.returns: Returns the border style of column. Returns null if it fails. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob@)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
A read-only blob created by GetStateStatus that is compared with the changeblob to determine the likely success of a subsequent call to SetChanges.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString@)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
A read-only blob created by GetStateStatus that is compared with the changeblob to determine the likely success of a subsequent call to SetChanges.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetClickedColumn
member.summary: Obtains the number of the column the user clicked or double-clicked in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.returns: Returns the number of the column that the user clicked or double-clicked in dwcontrol. Returns 0 if the user did not click or double-click a column If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetClickedRow
member.summary: Obtains the number of the row the user clicked or double-clicked in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row that the user clicked or double-clicked in DataWindow control. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetColumnName
member.summary: Obtains the name of the current column. The current column is the column that has the focus.
member.returns: Returns the name of the current column in dwcontrol. Returns the empty string ("") if no column is current or if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetFormat(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Obtains the display format assigned to a column in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: The column number for which you want the display format.
member.returns: Returns the display format specification If an error occurs, GetFormat returns the empty string (" "). If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetFormat(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Obtains the display format assigned to a column in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: The column name for which you want the display format.
member.returns: Returns the display format specification If an error occurs, GetFormat returns the empty string (" "). If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetRow
member.summary: Reports the number of the current row in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.returns: Returns the number of the current row in dwcontrol. Returns 0 if no row is current and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetRowIdFromRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Gets the unique row identifier of a row in a DataWindow control or DataStore object from the row number associated with that row.
member.param: A number specifying the row number for which you want the associated row identifier.
member.returns: Returns the row identifier in buffer. Returns 0 if the row identifier is not in the current buffer and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.returns: Returns the row identifier in buffer. Returns 0 if the row identifier is not in the current buffer and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetSelectedRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Reports the number of the next highlighted row after a specified row in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: A value identifying the location of the row after which you want to search for the next selected row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the first row that is selected after row in dwcontrol. Returns 0 if no row is selected after the specified row. If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetSQLSelect
member.summary: Reports the SQL SELECT statement associated with a DataWindow
member.returns: Returns the current SQL SELECT statement GetSQLSelect returns the empty string ("") if it cannot return the statement. If dwcontrol is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetText
member.summary: Obtains the value in the edit control over the current row and column.
member.returns: Returns the value in the edit control over the current row and column. Returns the empty string (" ") if no column is currently selected in dwcontrol. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetTrans(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBTransaction)
member.summary: Gets the values for the DataWindow control or DataStore object's internal transaction object and stores these values in the programmer-specified transaction object.
member.param: The name of the transaction object into which you want to put the values
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument value is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetValidate(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Obtains the validation rule for a column in a DataWindow.
member.param: The column number for which you want the validation rule.
member.returns: Returns the validation rule for column Returns the empty string ("") if no validation criteria are defined for the column. If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.GetValidate(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Obtains the validation rule for a column in a DataWindow.

The number of the item in the value list or the code table for the edit style.
member.returns: Returns the item identified by index in the value list or the code table associated with column of dwcontrol. member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.InsertRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Inserts a row in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row before which you want to insert a row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row that was added if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.IsSelected(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Determines whether a row is selected in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row you want to test to see if it is selected
member.returns: Returns true if row in dwcontrol is selected and false if it is not selected. If row is greater than the number of rows in dwcontrol or is 0 or negative, IsSelected also returns false. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ModifiedCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that have been modified but not updated in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows that have been modified in the primary buffer. Returns 0 if no rows have been modified or if all modified rows have been updated in the database table. Returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ScrollNextPage
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control forward one page
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the last row. ScrollNextPage returns 1 with nested or composite reports and child DataWindows since, in these cases, the current row cannot be changed. ScrollNextPage returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ScrollNextRow
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control to the next row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the last row. ScrollNextRow returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ScrollPriorPage
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control backward one page, displaying another group of rows in the DataWindow's display area.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the first row. ScrollPriorPage returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.ScrollToRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control to the specified row.
member.param: A value identifying the row to which you want to scroll.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row to which the DataWindow scrolls if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, the method returns 1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.FindGroupChange(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Searches for the next break for the specified group. A group break occurs when the value in the column for the group changes.
member.param: A value identifying the row at which you want to begin searching for the group break.
The number of the group for which you are searching.
member.returns: Returns 0 if the value in the group column did not change and a negative number if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If the starting row is: (1) The first row in a group, then FindGroupChange returns the starting row number (2) A row within a group, other than the last group, then FindGroupChange returns the row number of the first row of the next group (3) A row in the last group, other than the first row of the last group, then FindGroupChange returns 0

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild.Object
member.summary:
Gets the object
The Object property of the DataWindow control lets you specify expressions that refer directly to the data of the DataWindow object in the control. This direct data manipulation allows you to access small and large amounts of data in a single statement, without calling methods.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBCheckBox.FontCharSet
member.summary: Gets or sets the font character set used for the text in the control. The application must be running on an appropriate version of PowerBuilder under an operating system that supports the selected character set. For a complete list of possible values, see the list of properties for the FontCharSet variable on the Enumerated tab page of the Browser.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBRichTextEdit.SelectText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Selects text beginning and ending at a line and character position in a RichTextEdit control.
member.param: A long specifying the line number where the selection starts.
A long specifying the number in the line of the first character in the selection.
A long specifying the line number where the selection ends. To specify an insertion point, set toline and tochar to 0.
A long specifying the number in the line of the character before which the selection ends.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters selected. A carriage return with a line feed counts as a single character. If an error occurs SelectText returns -1. If any argument's value is null, it returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBRichTextEdit.SelectText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBandValue)

A long specifying the number in the line of the character before which the selection ends.
A value of the Band enumerated datatype specifying the band in which to make the selection.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters selected. A carriage return with a line feed counts as a single character. If an error occurs SelectText returns -1. If any argument's value is null, it returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.FindItem(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDirectionValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean)
member.summary: Search for the next item relative to a specific location in the ListView control.
member.param: The index number from which you want your search to begin.
The direction in which to search. Values are:DirectionAll!DirectionUp!DirectionDown!DirectionLeft!DirectionRight!
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that has focus.
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that is selected.
If set to true, the search looks for the next ListView item that is the target of a cut operation.
If set to true, the search looks for next ListView item that is the target of a drag and drop operation.
member.returns: Integer. Returns the index of the item found if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.FindItem(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean)
member.summary: Searches for the next item whose label matches the specified search text.
member.param: The index number from which you want your search to begin
The string that is the target of the search
If set to true, the search looks for a partial label match
If set to true, the search returns to the first index item after it has finished
member.returns: Integer. Returns the index of the item found if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Obtains the number of the selected item in a ListBox or ListView control.
member.returns: Returns the index of the selected item in listcontrolname. If more than one item is selected, SelectedIndex returns the index of the first selected item. member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.SetOverlayPicture(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Puts an image in the control's image list into an overlay image list.
member.param: The index number of the overlay picture in the overlay image list. The overlay image list is a 1-based array. Overlayindex must be 1 (for the first image), a previously designated index (replacing an image), or 1 greater than the current largest index (adding another image). SetOverlayPicture fails if you specify an index that creates gaps in the array.

The index number of an image in the control's main image list. For ListViews, both the large and small pictures at that index become overlay images. The image is still available for use as an item's main image.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.TotalItems
member.summary: Determines the total number of items in a ListBox control.
member.returns: Returns the total number of items in listcontrolname. If listcontrolname contains no items, TotalItems returns 0. If an error occurs, it returns -1. If listcontrolname is null, TotalItems returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBListView.TotalSelected
member.summary: Determines the number of items in a ListBox control that are selected.
member.returns: Returns the number of items in listcontrolname that are selected. If no items in listcontrolname are selected, TotalSelected returns 0. If an error occurs, it returns -1. If listcontrolname is null, TotalSelected returns null.

A reference to the column containing the item whose value has been changed.

A reference to the column containing the item. Dwo is a reference to the column control, not the name of the column.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.DBErrorCode

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.DBErrorMessage

member.param: A string whose value is a blank-separated list of properties or Evaluate functions
member.returns: Returns a string that includes a value for each property or Evaluate function. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Find(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Finds the next row in a DataWindow or DataStore in which data meets a specified condition.
member.param: A string whose value is a boolean expression that you want to use as the search criterion. The expression includes column names.
A value identifying the row location at which to begin the search.
A value identifying the row location at which to end the search.
member.returns: Returns the number of the first row that meets the search criteria within the search range. Returns 0 if no rows are found. -1 General error -5 Bad argument If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Find(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDWBufferValue)
member.summary: Finds the next row in a DataWindow or DataStore in which data meets a specified condition.
member.param: A string whose value is a boolean expression that you want to use as the search criterion. The expression includes column names.
A value identifying the row location at which to begin the search.
A value identifying the row location at which to end the search.
A value indicating the DataWindow buffer you want to search for required row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the first row that meets the search criteria within the search range. Returns 0 if no rows are found. -1 General error -5 Bad argument If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.FindGroupChange(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Searches for the next break for the specified group. A group break occurs when the value in the column for the group changes.
member.param: A value identifying the row at which you want to begin searching for the group break.
The number of the group for which you are searching.
member.returns: Returns 0 if the value in the group column did not change and a negative number if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If the starting row is: (1) The first row in a group, then FindGroupChange returns the starting row number (2) A row within a group, other than the last group, then FindGroupChange returns the row number of the first row of the next group (3) A row in the last group, other than the first row of the last group, then FindGroupChange returns 0

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.FindRequired(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDWBufferValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean)
member.summary: Reports the next row and column that is required and contains a null value.
member.param: A value indicating the DataWindow buffer you want to search for required columns.
A value identifying the first row to be searched. r also stores the number of the found row.
A value identifying the first column to be searched. c also stores the number of the found column.
A string in which you want to store the name of the required column that contains a null value
A value indicating whether you want to validate all rows and columns
member.returns: Returns 1 if FindRequired successfully checked the rows and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.DeletedCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that have been marked for deletion in the database.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows that have been deleted from dwcontrol but not updated in the associated database table. Returns 0 if no rows have been deleted or if all the deleted rows have been updated in the database table. DeletedCount returns -1 if it fails. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.DeleteRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Deletes a row from a DataWindow control, DataStore object, or child DataWindow.
member.param: A value identifying the row you want to delete. To delete the current row, specify 0 for row.
member.returns: Returns 1 if the row is successfully deleted and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Filter
member.summary: Displays rows in a DataWindow that pass the current filter criteria. Rows that do not meet the filter criteria are moved to the filter buffer.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.FilteredCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that are not displayed in the DataWindow because of the current filter criteria.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in dwcontrol that are not displayed because they do not meet the current filter criteria. Returns 0 if all rows are displayed and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob@)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob)
member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
A read-only blob created by GetStateStatus that is compared with the changeblob to determine the likely success of a subsequent call to SetChanges.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.summary: Retrieves changes made to a DataWindow or DataStore as a blob.
member.param: A variable into which the returned DataWindow changes will be placed.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows in the DataWindow change blob if it succeeds and one of the following values if it fails: -1 An internal error occurred. -2 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; an attempt to use this blob in a SetChanges call against the DataWindow will fail. -3 There is a conflict between the state of the DataWindow change blob and the state of the DataWindow from which the cookie was created; but partial changes from the change blob can be applied. If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetChanges(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob)

If any argument is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetClickedColumn
member.summary: Obtains the number of the column the user clicked or double-clicked in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.returns: Returns the number of the column that the user clicked or double-clicked in dwcontrol. Returns 0 if the user did not click or double-click a column If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetClickedRow
member.summary: Obtains the number of the row the user clicked or double-clicked in a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row that the user clicked or double-clicked in DataWindow control. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetColumn
member.summary: Obtains the number of the current column. The current column is the column that has focus.
member.returns: Returns the number of the current column in DataWindow control. Returns 0 if no column is current,and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetColumnName
member.summary: Obtains the name of the current column. The current column is the column that has the focus.
member.returns: Returns the name of the current column in dwcontrol. Returns the empty string ("") if no column is current or if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.InsertRow(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Inserts a row in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row before which you want to insert a row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row that was added if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null. If there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore, this method returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.IsSelected(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Determines whether a row is selected in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A value identifying the row you want to test to see if it is selected
member.returns: Returns true if row in dwcontrol is selected and false if it is not selected. If row is greater than the number of rows in dwcontrol or is 0 or negative, IsSelected also returns false. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ModifiedCount
member.summary: Reports the number of rows that have been modified but not updated in a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.returns: Returns the number of rows that have been modified in the primary buffer. Returns 0 if no rows have been modified or if all modified rows have been updated in the database table. Returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ScrollNextPage
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control forward one page
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the last row. ScrollNextPage returns 1 with nested or composite reports and child DataWindows since, in these cases, the current row cannot be changed. ScrollNextPage returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ScrollNextRow
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control to the next row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the last row. ScrollNextRow returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ScrollPriorPage
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control backward one page, displaying another group of rows in the DataWindow's display area.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the first row. ScrollPriorPage returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ScrollPriorRow
member.summary: Scrolls a DataWindow control backward one row.
member.returns: Returns the number of the row displayed at the top of the DataWindow control when the scroll finishes or tries to scroll past the first row. ScrollPriorRow returns -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.returns: Returns the number of the row to which the DataWindow scrolls if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SetFullState(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBlob)
member.summary: Applies the contents of a DataWindow blob retrieved by GetFullState to a DataWindow or DataStore.
member.param: A blob that contains the state information you want to apply to the DataWindow control or DataStore
member.returns: Returns -1 if an error occurs 1 DataWindow objects match; old data and state overwritten. 2 DataWindow objects do not match; old object, data, and state replaced. 3 No DataWindow object associated with DataWindow control or DataStore; the DataWindow object associated with the blob is used. The value of the DataObject property remains an empty string. Null If any argument's value is null in PowerBuilder or JavaScript, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SetFullState(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Applies the contents of a DataWindow blob retrieved by GetFullState to a DataWindow or DataStore.

member.returns: Returns -1 if an error occurs 1 DataWindow objects match; old data and state overwritten. 2 DataWindow objects do not match; old object, data, and state replaced. 3 No DataWindow object associated with DataWindow control or DataStore; the DataWindow object associated with the blob is used. The value of the DataObject property remains an empty string. Null If any argument's value is null in PowerBuilder or JavaScript, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SetHTMLAction(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Accepts action and context information about user interaction with the Web DataWindow client control in a Web browser so that newly generated HTML can reflect any requested changes.
member.param: A string describing an action associated with a button click or method call in a Web DataWindow client control on a Web page.
A string describing the context of action in the Web DataWindow client control.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and one of these negative values if an error occurs: -1 Reloading the current context failed. -2 The action was attempted but it failed. -3 The action could not be performed (for example, the action was InsertRow but the DataWindow has no editable fields for entering new data). -4 The action was aborted by the HTMLContextApplied event. -5 The action is invalid.

member.param: The secondary DataStore
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.dwShareData(Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow)
member.summary: Shares data retrieved by one DataWindow control with another DataWindow control or DataStore.
member.param: The secondary DataStore
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.dwShareData(Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindowChild)
member.summary: Shares data retrieved by one DataWindow control with another DataWindow control or DataStore.
member.param: The secondary DataStore
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.dwShareDataOff
member.summary: Turns off the sharing of data buffers for a DataWindow control or DataStore.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.CanUndo
member.summary: Tests whether Undo can reverse the most recent edit in the editable control over the current row and column.
member.returns: Returns true if the last edit can be reversed (undone) using the Undo method and false if the last edit cannot be reversed. If dwcontrol is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Clear
member.summary: Deletes selected text in the edit control over the current row and column, but does not store it in the clipboard.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that Clear removed from dwcontrol. If no text is selected, no characters are removed and Clear returns 0. If an error occurs, Clear returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Copy
member.summary: Puts selected text from the current row and column of an edit control onto the clipboard.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that were copied to the clipboard. If no text is selected in objectref, no characters are copied and Copy returns 0. If an error occurs, Copy returns -1.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Cut
member.summary: Deletes selected text in the current row and column of an edit control and stores it on the clipboard, replacing the clipboard contents with the deleted text.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that were cut from dwcontrol and stored in the clipboard. If no text is selected, no characters are cut and Cut returns 0. If an error occurs, Cut returns -1. If dwcontrol is null, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.LineCount
member.summary: Determines the number of lines in an edit control that allows multiple lines.
member.returns: Returns the number of lines in dwcontrol if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If dwcontrol is null, LineCount returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Paste
member.summary: Inserts (pastes) the contents of the clipboard into the specified control.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters that were pasted into the edit control for dwcontrol. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Position
member.summary: Reports the position of the insertion point in a DataWindow.
member.returns: Returns the location of the insertion point in editname if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If editname is null, Position returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.ReplaceText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString)
member.summary: Replaces selected text in the edit control for the current row and column with a specified string.
member.param: The string that replaces the selected text
member.returns: Returns the number of characters in string and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Scroll(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Scrolls the edit control of a DataWindow a specified number of lines up or down.
member.param: A value specifying the direction and number of lines you want to scroll.
member.returns: Scroll returns the line number of the first visible line in dwcontrol if it succeeds. Scroll returns -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, Scroll returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SelectedLength
member.summary: Determines the total number of characters in the selected text in an edit control, including spaces and line endings.
member.returns: Returns the length of the selected text in dwcontrol. If no text is selected, SelectedLength returns 0. If an error occurs, it returns -1. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SelectedLine
member.summary: Obtains the number of the line that contains the insertion point in an editable control.
member.returns: Returns the number of the line containing the insertion point in dwcontrol. If an error occurs, SelectedLine returns -1. If dwcontrol is null, SelectedLine returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SelectedStart
member.summary: Reports the position of the first selected character in the edit control.
member.returns: Returns the starting position of the selected text in dwcontrol. If no text is selected, SelectedStart returns the position of the character immediately following the insertion point. If an error occurs, SelectedStart returns -1. If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SelectedText
member.summary: Obtains the selected text in the edit control of a DataWindow control.
member.returns: Returns the selected text in dwcontrol. If there is no selected text or if an error occurs, SelectedText returns the empty string (""). If dwcontrol is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.SelectText(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt)
member.summary: Selects text in an editable control.
member.param: A numeric value specifying the position at which you want to start the selection.
A numeric value specifying the number of characters you want to select.
member.returns: Returns the number of characters selected. If an error occurs, SelectText returns -1. If any argument's value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.TextLine
member.summary: Obtains the text of the line that contains the insertion point.
member.returns: Returns the text on the line with the insertion point in editname. If an error occurs, TextLine returns the empty string (""). If editname is null, TextLine returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Undo
member.summary: Cancels the last edit in an edit control, restoring the text to the content before the last change.
member.returns: Returns 1 when it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If editname is null, Undo returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetItemDate(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDWBufferValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBBoolean)
member.summary: Gets data whose type is Date from the specified buffer of a DataWindow control or DataStore object.
member.param: A value identifying the row location of the data.
The column number location of the data.
A value identifying the DataWindow buffer from which you want to get the data.
A boolean indicating whether you want the original or current values
member.returns: Returns the date value in the specified row and column. Returns null if the column value is null or if there is no DataWindow object assigned to the DataWindow control or DataStore. Returns 1900-01-01 if any other error occurs. If any argument value is null, in PowerBuilder and JavaScript the method returns null.

A string whose value is the name of the series for which you want the number of data points
member.returns: Returns the number of data points in the specified series if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, DataCount returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBFillPatternValue@)
member.summary: Obtains the fill pattern of a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the fill pattern of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the fill pattern.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type FillPattern in which you want to store the fill pattern value.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, GetDataStyle stores a value of the FillPattern enumerated datatype representing the fill pattern used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRSymbolTypeValue@)
member.summary: Obtains the symbol of a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the symbol type of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the symbol type.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type grSymbolType in which you want to store the symbol type.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. Stores, according to the type of symbolvariable, a value of that enumerated datatype representing the symbol used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLineStyleValue@)
member.summary: Obtains the line style and width for a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the line style and width of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the line style and width.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type LineStyle in which you want to store the line style.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, for the specified series and data point, GetDataStyle stores its line style in linestyle and the line's width in linewidth. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLineStyleValue@,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt@)
member.summary: Obtains the line style and width for a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the line style and width of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the line style and width.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type LineStyle in which you want to store the line style.
In PowerBuilder, an integer variable in which you want to store the width of the line. The width is measured in pixels.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, for the specified series and data point, GetDataStyle stores its line style in linestyle and the line's width in linewidth. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRColorTypeValue,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong@)
member.summary: Obtains the colors associated with a data point in a graph.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
The number of the series in which you want the color of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the color.
A value of the grColorType enumerated datatype (in PowerBuilder) or an integer (in JavaScript) specifying the aspect of the data point for which you want the color.
In PowerBuilder, a long variable in which you want to store the color.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, GetDataStyle stores an RGB color value in colorvariable. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.grFindCategory(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBDate)
member.summary: Obtains the number of a category in a graph when you know the category's label. The category values label the category axis.
member.param: A string whose value is the name of the graph in the DataWindow control.
A value that is the category for which you want the number. The value you specify must be the same datatype as the datatype of the category axis.
member.returns: Returns the number of the category named in categoryvalue in the graph. If an error occurs, FindCategory returns -1. If any argument's value is null, FindCategory returns null.

The number that identifies the series from which you want data.
The number of the data point for which you want the value.
member.returns: Returns the value of the data in datapoint if it succeeds, 0 if the series does not exist, and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, GetData returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetData(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRDataTypeValue)

The number of the data point for which you want the value.
A value of the grDataType enumerated datatype (in PowerBuilder) specifying whether you want the x or y value of the data point in a scatter graph.
member.returns: Returns the value of the data in datapoint if it succeeds, 0 if the series does not exist, and -1 if an error occurs. If any argument's value is null, GetData returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBFillPatternValue@)
member.summary: Obtains the fill pattern of a data point in a graph.

The number of the series in which you want the fill pattern of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the fill pattern.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type FillPattern in which you want to store the fill pattern value.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, GetDataStyle stores a value of the FillPattern enumerated datatype representing the fill pattern used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBGRSymbolTypeValue@)
member.summary: Obtains the symbol of a data point in a graph.

The number of the series in which you want the symbol type of a data point.
The number of the data point for which you want the symbol type.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type grSymbolType in which you want to store the symbol type.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. Stores, according to the type of symbolvariable, a value of that enumerated datatype representing the symbol used for the specified data point. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.GetDataStyle(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBString,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBInt,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLineStyleValue@)

The number of the data point for which you want the line style and width.
In PowerBuilder, a variable of type LineStyle in which you want to store the line style.
member.returns: Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if an error occurs. In PowerBuilder, for the specified series and data point, GetDataStyle stores its line style in linestyle and the line's width in linewidth. If any argument's value is null, GetDataStyle returns null.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Border
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Border
When the Border property is enabled, the DataWindow control has a border.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.BorderStyle
member.summary:
Gets or sets the borderstyle
The border style of the DataWindow control

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.DataObject
member.summary:
Gets or sets the dataobject
The name of the DataWindow object

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Enabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets the enabled
Whether the DataWindow control is Enabled

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.HScrollBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the hscrollbar When the HScroll Bar property is enabled, a horizontal scroll bar appears when all of the data cannot be displayed at one time. If this property is not enabled, no horizontal scroll bar appears.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.LiveScroll
member.summary:
Gets or sets the livescroll
When the LiveScroll property is enabled, the rows in the DataWindow control scroll while the user is moving the scroll box. If this property is not enabled, the rows do not scroll until the user releases the scroll box.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Object
member.summary:
Gets the object
The Object property of the DataWindow control lets you specify expressions that refer directly to the data of the DataWindow object in the control. This direct data manipulation allows you to access small and large amounts of data in a single statement, without calling methods.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.RightToLeft
member.summary:
Gets or sets the righttoleft
The RightToLeft property specifies that characters should be displayed in right-to-left order. The application must be running on an operating system that supports right-to-left display.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.VScrollBar
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vscrollbar
When the VScrollBar property is enabled, PowerBuilder adds a vertical scroll bar to the right of DataWindow control when the contents of the object are outside the borders.

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the Height property of the control

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the Width property of the control

member.name: P:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBDataWindow.Resizable
member.summary:
Gets or sets the resizable
A resizable DataWindow has a thick border, and the user can use the mouse or the keyboard to resize it.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBAnimation.Play(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong,Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Starts playing an animation (an AVI clip).
member.param: A long value in the range 0 to 65,535 indicating the frame where playing starts. The value 0 starts playing the clip at the first frame.
A long value in the range -1 to 65,535 indicating the frame where playing ends. The value -1 stops playing the clip at the last frame.
A long value in the range -1 to 65,535 indicating the number of times to replay the clip. The value -1 continues playing the clip indefinitely.
member.returns: Integer. Returns 1 for success and -1 for failure.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBAnimation.Seek(Sybase.PowerBuilder.PBLong)
member.summary: Displays a specific frame in an AVI clip in an animation control.
member.param: A long value in the range 0 to 65,535 indicating the frame to display
member.returns: Integer. Returns 1 for success and -1 for failure.

member.name: M:Sybase.PowerBuilder.WPF.PBAnimation.Stop
member.summary: Stops an animation (an AVI clip) from playing.
member.returns: Integer. Returns 1 if it succeeds and -1 if the animation is not running or could not be stopped.
